intro: Eriogonum ordii, commonly known as Ord's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, oval leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum ordii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems.
